Technology is taken for granted these days. For instance, imagine life without cell phones, the internet, cars and the microwave. Now let's go further and imagine life without antibiotics, birth control, pain medication, cloth diapers and washing machines. Imagine you had to walk everywhere and clean clothes by hand. On top of this, you didn't have any toys for your kids that took electricity including batteries. Even worse, no electricity means no refrigerator or stove either. How would you keep food fresh? How would you keep your kids from getting sick? Do we want to go back to the ages when people had large numbers of kids because roughly half didn't make it past the age of 6? I don't know about you, but I have a deep appreciation for science and technology!
